climbs.name: Woober's First Time
climbs.fa: Mike Schneiter, Joy Schneiter & Brad Gepfert

content.description: Climb past five bolts via mostly easy climbing that has some awkward moves. It's 5.9 to the last bolt where the strenuous crux awaits. Pull the moves free for a 10+ or pull on the bolt for a 5.9 A0.
content.protection: Five bolts and two-bolt chain anchor.
content.location:
This is the route on the far right side of the Front Porch. It starts approximately 30 feet right of

Choss Warfare

, on a small ledge.

content.description:
Climb the arete just to the right of

Cleanup Hitter

. An easy start leads to a distinct crux through the 2nd to 4th bolts.
content.location:
This is between

Cleanup Hitter

and

Slice and Dice

. Amazingly, it is not a squeeze job.

climbs.name: Slice and Dice
climbs.fa: Mike Schneiter, BJ Sbarra & Joy Schneiter

content.description:
Easy climbing on big holds leads to the short, but quality headwall with a good, sustained crux of technical climbing and powerful moves. This route probably deserves 2-1/2 stars, but not 3 as it's not quite as classic as the other routes on The Front Porch. Don't be alarmed by the name as the route is clean and enjoyable. The name comes from a rather memorable bout with loose rock at the top of the cliff while establishing this climb and

Choss Warfare

.
content.location:
This is the first route on the right side of the Front Porch, where the routes are shorter (it's the sixth total route from the left). From

Cleanup Hitter

, you scramble up, along the base of the wall, to a reinforced ledge at the base of the climb.

content.description: Pulling jugs down low with a technical crux up high. Great rock and great climbing.
content.location:
Second route from the left at The Front Porch, ten feet right of

One Step Closer

.

content.description:
Party At Your Mama's House is a fine climb featuring big holds and steep climbing. As one climber noted, "I've never been so pumped on a 5.10!" The climb shares the start and first bolt with

Punchin' the Clock

and then moves right to clip the second bolt, which is situated by a small pine sapling on a small ledge. The ledge serves as a great jug to clip from although some may prefer to stick clip the second bolt. From there, continue the jug haul to the chains and enjoy!
content.location:
This is the third route from the left on The Front Porch. It shares the start and first bolt with

Punchin' the Clock

, the route to the left. And, it shares an anchor with Cleanup Hitter, the route to the right. Also, for identification, there is a small pine sapling on the small ledge by the 2nd bolt.

climbs.name: Girdle on the Porch
climbs.fa: Tobin Sanson, Lynn Sanson, Scott Nykerk

content.description:
This is a Front Porch traverse derived from the brilliant mind of one Lynn Sanson. It is a bit contrived but fun none the less! Start on the first bolt of

Cleanup Hitter

, then move left and clip the second and third bolts of

Back From the Dead

. Continue left to the forth and fifth bolts of

Party At Your Mama's House

then the fifth and sixth bolt of

Punchin' the Clock

and finish on the last bolt and anchor of

One Step Closer

.
content.protection: 8 draws, you may want runners to avoid rope drag.

content.description: Climb up the fun face/corner, passing a couple of bolts along the way. One of the better easy routes at the Narrows.
content.protection: Take some cams from orange TCU to blue Camalot.
content.location: Follow the main trail past the turnoff for the main Front Porch climbs. After a couple more switchbacks, you'll see a clean plaque of rock on the right. Follow a faint trail to the base.

content.description: Great climbing on great rock with a definite crux halfway up.
content.location: First route on the left at the Front Porch.

content.description:
Cleanup Hitter is a great climb, that trends left at the start and then climbs straight up on great rock, featuring two distinct and different cruxes. The first crux involves long reaches around the second and third bolts. The second crux is high on the route and is more technical in nature, featuring devious sidepulls and footwork. Cleanup Hitter shares an anchor with

Party At Your Mama's House

, the next route to the left. This was a long-standing project begun by BJ Sbarra that was finished this fall, hence the name. There is also a direct start called

Back From The Dead

that begins directly above the tree stump.
content.location: This is the fifth climb from the left on The Front Porch and the last of the "longer" climbs on the cliff. It starts just right of a tree stump.

content.description:
Good climbing on big holds leads to a fun, "reachy" set of moves on good holds on the high quality face. This route may be hard for a 5.9+, particularly if you're shorter. Don't be alarmed by the name as the route is clean and enjoyable. The name comes from a rather memorable bout with loose rock at the top of the cliff while establishing this climb and

Slice and Dice

.
content.location:
This is the second route from the left on the right side of the Front Porch (the seventh total route from the left). Scramble up from

Cleanup Hitter

along the base of the wall to a reinforced ledge that serves as the base for

Slice and Dice

and Choss Warfare, just to the right.

content.description:
This route is the direct start of

Cleanup Hitter

, joining that route after the third bolt. It was originally cleaned, partially bolted and then abandoned in favor of

Cleanup Hitter

. After working out the moves and bolt placements, it was brought "back from the dead" and added to the menu of fine climbs at the Front Porch.

Climb on good, gray rock directly above a tree stump. At the second bolt make a difficult move through an overlap; locking off on a good edge to an undercling in the overlap and crossing over to the left. Continue above to a second, shorter crux that consists of sidepulls and technical footwork and body placement. Finish on big, positive holds.
content.location: Located directly above a tree stump, this climb is the fourth route from the left at the Front Porch.
